alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 1:44AM MST until January 04 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Periods of snow will continue through the mid-morning hours, becoming scattered to numerous snow showers during the afternoon. Due to the potential for locally heavy snow showers Thursday afternoon, the Winter WEather ADvisory has been extended in time. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Eagar- Springerville, Ganado, Pinetop-Lakeside, Saint Johns, Show Low, Whiteriver and Window Rock. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Additional snow forecast from 1 AM Today to 6 PM Today: Alpine 2 to 4 inches Buffalo Pass 5 to 9 inches Eagar-Sprgrvlle 1 to 3 inches Ganado 4 to 6 inches Pinetop-Lkside 2 to 4 inches Saint Johns 0 to 1 inches Show Low 1 to 3 inches Whiteriver 1 to 2 inches Window Rock 3 to 5 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
